title: Everaise Academy
description: I co-founded a 501(c)(3) non-profit online STEM school that offers courses in Math, Physics, Biology, and Astronomy. As program coordinator, I conducted outreach campaigns to recruit over 50 qualified high school and college students, reaching over 1,500 students from 40+ countries. Furthermore, I headed book publishing and delivery; managed finances; directed web design; organized partnerships and acquired $15k in sponsorships; and coordinated school-wide events such as competitions and guest lectures from professors and industry leaders.

title: Toga Junior Math Club
description: As a Head Coach for Redwood Middle Schoolâ€™s Math Club, I created a comprehensive 3-year rotating curriculum covering advanced topics in Algebra, Geometry, Combinatorics, and Number Theory. As Liaison, I organized club events and contest participation and facilitated communication between administrators, volunteers, parents and students. I was also a founding member for the South Santa Clara Valley MATHCOUNTS Chapter and served as the lead coordinator for testing logistics, proctoring, and grading for 12 local middle schools.

title: Boys Team Charity, Saratoga Chapter
description: As president of a volunteer chapter with 150+ members, I organized guest speaker and charity events. As a volunteer, I served as a STEM project designer and lead at the Sunday Friends low-income community center: in addition to setting up a database of math problems for K-6 students, I led activities on acids and bases with model volcanoes, momentum and energy with egg drop challenges, and polygons and symmetry with origami.
